caption: 📣very important📣  If you are a coffee lover, and you want to sit in a clean and quiet place, then you, my friend, are in the right place and really distinguished by the service and the delicious taste.  The place is clean and sterile 🏚🧴 The coffee is very delicious ☕🧋😋 The decor is very cool 🙂 The price is very reasonable 💲 The service is great 😀👍 The staff are friendly and work professionally 👌😊  ⚠️ Warning ⚠️ Watch your steps, my friend 👣👣👣  I liked 🤗 I recommend it 🙂👍
Such a wonderful experience at this restaurant with my company! They were so attentive and treated us so great! Our glasses were never empty and everything was served perfectly!
Wonderful service provided by your staff to the Atrium dinner on March 10th.  The food was supperb.
Been going here since 2015, from graduation to mother's day. Scallops and steak are always incredible. And you can't go wrong with any of their wines.

My company (Atrium Management) had an event at the restaurant this past Wednesday night and the location, food, service and attention to detail was definitely 5 star on all levels.  We wanted to have a 5 star service experience to discuss with our team during our training sessions this week, and it worked out great.  Thanks to the team at Mark's!!

Steak was great, sides are hit or miss, service is decent, prices are a little high, when you are spending 200 on a meal you expect everything to be on point. Pictured, delmonico oscar style, a bone-in ribeye, au gratin, risotto, and bacon wrapped scallops for the appetizer, second only to the steak the scallops were the best, steak was cooked properly, sides were bland and mushy, the server was kinda enough to remove one of the sides without us asking.
Marks Prime Steakhouse is a delightful experience for a special occasion.  All of the food was prepared to perfection and the service was top notch!
Zachary was by far the BEST waiter I’ve had EVER! His knowledge of the menu, his respectfulness, his attention to detail, EVERYTHING! He made my dining experience superb!
Best steak ever.

My wonderful husband planned an evening plus ultra at Mark's for our early Valentine's celebration. Our guide through this ethereal culinary adventure was Jonathan, who we've had the pleasure of meeting before. Jonathan never disappoints - I don't think he has the ability to be less than stellar. He gave superb recommendations (you can't go wrong with lobster escargot and the delmonico), and the entire staff made us feel like royalty from the moment we arrived. We finished off our meal with a transcendent cheesecake. This place, with its delicacies and masterful team, will stoke the fires of your love through the magic of food
amazing place and amazing service. you've gotta try the cheesecake! my boyfriend and I literally fought over last bite! fantastic fine dining experience and definitely a highlight of Gainesville.
Came for my birthday, 1st time there the restaurant and service was A-1 Top Notch!! Will definitely come back.

We frequent Mark's as a couple and a group and it is always stellar service. We just recently went as a large group, rented a room and it was fantastic. Our servers Tony and Vince were incredibly accommodating, especially for a rowdy group celebrating a birthday, our food was on time, our drinks were always fresh. It solidified why we enjoy Mark's so much. Of course, we will be back!

Some of the best social distancing and everyone on staff had on what appeared to be high quality masks as well as gloves the food was fantastic 👌 the staff addressed my special needs as an immunocompromised transplant recipient and the chef made sure that the ingredients that could interact badly with my medications were not in the items that were ordered 😀 a pleasure to dine at a place that places the safety of their customers over politics and has some of  the best service and food in the Gainesville area! 😉
Excellent service by Zachary
Great, intimate restaurant with delicious food.

Marks prime steakhouse is a personal favorite of mine the service is unmatchable of course! Take note of the bar that is a tiger stripe mahogany wood and is extraordinarily beautiful. The place leaves you feeling ritzy for sure. Of course it's a bit pricier because it should be and we don't ever complain about it either because the level of excellence this place achieves is way beyond the price you pay. So there it is folks I've made up your mind for you... Why are you still here reading what I've got to say about this place. It's worth it GO!
Outstanding service and food. The steak, mushrooms, & potatoes were amazing! Jessica has been working there for 18 years & knew everything about everything, very impressive. Give her another raise!
Loved it
Great staff, quiet atmosphere, and great food. A must try for anyone who enjoys a good steak dinner.
Enjoyed a spectacular filet mignon with bernaise sauce with six guests. Very attentive service and delicious food. I look forward to returning here on my next visit to Gainesville.
The sides were amazing. The steak was okay. The old fashioned was ehh.
Best around
We love the bar for special occasion happy hour celebrations.
I liked Mark's prime because the food was good and our server was really nice!

Great meal !!! Great service !!!! Very laid back and staff very nice. Food was excellent !!! Atmosphere very nice which made coversation great Did not have a reservation however, they had no problem getting us in.
Excellent!  100% in all ways.
Excellent food and service. Highly recommend
Excellent, would love to come back if the chance presents itself

We dined at Mark’s last night to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary and all the hype we have always heard did not disappoint! We are townies but have never been here before and I’m kicking myself for taking so long.  Everything from the fresh, warm bread to the dessert was wonderful! We had the Lobster Escargot as an appetizer which was phenomenal. I had the 11oz Filet which was cooked perfectly. Honestly, I could have gotten away with the Petite Filet because the side portions are just huge! Broccolini with Toasted Almonds was the Seasonal Veggie and I wish I could have just taken a huge order home of it. Also, do yourself a favor and get the Lyonnaise Potatoes. You will thank me later! Everything should be fried in Duck Fat. There is nothing better!  My husband got their Ultimate Burger, which made me roll my eyes, but he likes to judge a restaurant on their burgers. If you can screw up something so simple, it says a lot! Mark’s did not disappoint him. The size was huge, it was cooked just like he likes it (medium-well) but it was still juicy and not a hockey puck. He said it was well worth it and he promised me he would order a steak the next time we went.  They treated us to a Chocolate Paradise dessert since it was our anniversary, which was amazing. It was like a giant truffle! It was the perfect ending to a perfect meal.  The service was spot-on from the moment we walked in the door to our amazing waitress, Becca. Ask for her when you go and tell her you read a review about her, it will make her night! She answered all my questions and gave me all her top recommendations which were perfect.  Thank you, Mark’s Prime for giving us a wonderful and memorable night!
had a friend come into town and asked me to take him here again. feeling here is similar to a place in columbus i liked.
First time and the food was excited 👏
Jonathan is the best tableside concierge at any fine eatery.
Very good place to dine. Enjoyed my Experience. My wife treated me to a Birthday meal I must say that they showed up with their A game. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself..... you deserve it
The food is incredible!   We enjoyed the steaks we ordered and the tranquility of the restaurant.  All recommendations made by the server were appreciated.
My Delmonico Steak was killer, mashed potatoes were killer. Everything was killer. Great birthday dinner.
Very nice place great steaks and excellent service!
Great service and food
Wonderful Staff Atlantic  Cod with Diver scallops  special  is a keeper Anniversary  dinner was a success  as expected
Expensive but worth it!  Best food and service in Ocala!!

Easily one of the best Steakhouses I've been to, I would absolutely recommend to anyone who loves a good steak. The sides are served family style (I haven't had a side I didnt like) which makes it nice to get a few different ones to share with the group. It's more on the expensive side (compared to other places in Gainesville) but it also makes a wonderful place to take a date. I will be going back.

Good food, but the check had too many surprises. When we got back we felt that the amount charged didn't make sense so we went line by line and came across a few things. For example, there was a promotion on the night that if you spent $100, there was a $25 rebate. Our bill was $188 before tax and tips, but no rebate was applied. Another example is that we asked if we could replace the fries with a burger with baked potato, but never was it mentioned it would cost an extra $8.95. So while the food was good, we are left with a bad aftertaste and will never go there again.
Everything was great

My husband and i had such a wonderful dinner at Marks Prime! Zachary went above and beyond to make sure we were happy. He recommended a wine that we both loved! All of the food we ordered was delicious. Our steaks were cooked perfectly. I cannot say enough good things about our experience. Thank you to Zachary and Marks Prime for making our anniversary dinner a perfect evening.
Loved their wood grilled salmon! And the NY style cheesecake was one of the solfest and creamiest cheesecakes i have ever had!
Amazing food and I had the best old fashioned I've had in Gainesville here. It's definitely pricey, but worth it for special occasions.

I ordered an 11oz filet medium that had to be sent back two times.  Prior to that, I had to ask 2 times for a 2nd glass of wine, had to ask for bread and butter, never was offered a glass of water. When the 3rd filet finally came out, it was done the way I asked for it, but the quality of steak could not be prime...way too tough. So disappointed in this experience. This is an extremely poorly managed restaurant.
Not the best filet mignon but good meal with escargot

Great ambiance, especially the bar. It's from the 1800s from Key West and absolutely beautiful. The French Onion soup and Lobster Escargot are delicious, and the blue cheese dressing on the Wedge and the Original Bleu salads is the best blue cheese dressing you'll ever taste in your life.
My steak was not cooked properly,  they rushed it and it was burnt on the outside. I was in a hurry so I didn't have time for them to make another one.
One of the best steaks I've had in a while. The waiters were outstanding and the food was wonderful. I'll be eating here again soon
Food is very good, service too. Not inexpensive but a great experience
Great restaurant in Gainesville for a nice dinner
Decor feels a bit heavy and prices are steep for what you get, but they have a surprisingly good happy hour worth checking out
The food was Delicious and the bartenders  were Awesome

First time dining here and we were very impressed indeed. The staff was extremely helpful and nice, the food was fantastic and it came surprisingly quickly. We both had seafood dishes and they were amazing, so don't feel this is purely a steak house. This is now on the top of our list for future dining in Gainesville! I've been to Mark's twice and they know steak. Side dishes are creative, great wine list, a beautiful bar with excellent bartenders. You will need a reservation anytime there is a Florida Gators football game, but it's worth the wait.
Best steak in Gainesville.
Jon A was very theatrical loved the recommendation from Jon the Sea Bass was delicious highly recommend as well as drinks plus dessert. The best place to eat.
Mark's Prime is what a steakhouse used to be and still should be. The service is impeccable,  the food is phenomenal,  and considering the food and service, the prices are reasonable.
I like the food, but it’s not worth the price.
Good service, food was good but overpriced. Delmonico was tender and cooked well, just very under seasoned.
Excellent service and very good food. We don't end up going often, but we really look forward to every time we do.
Bad service
Excellent Meal, great service, highly recommended!

Second only to my own fiance's home-cooked steak. Good service and good steak, cooked to perfection the way you want it every time. Each time as tender and wonderful as the last. They have other food too I guess, but I've never had it. I love their steaks!
Great place!
Great food.  Excellent service.
Husband loved his pork chop the service was wonderful
One of my top 10 favorite Steakhouses

Usually go several times during the year for pleasure and work related events. Has always been a great experience, but this trip was just ok. Food and service was not on par with previous vists. Hopefully a better experience next time.
I make a better steak than this joint, and to pay 50$ for one with no sides included is a joke.
Fantastic service! Enjoyed the recommendation - Grouper Santa Fe. Delish!

Susie was our server and she was excellent. My steak was delicious and so was the lobster Mac and cheese. My husband had the mixed seafood and it was very good. I would definitely come again if I lived here.
Love Becca at the beautiful bar!
been here twice.  If we are ever in Gainsville again, we will stop.  Great food, great service.
Amazing

Mark's is a class act, and they have excellent management that care about their reputation and customers.  I make it a point to go to Mark's every special event that comes up, birthdays, anniversaries, etc.  It is a perfect environment for a romantic dinner, with exceptional food and service.  Best steak in town hands down.
Excellent food and awesome service 👍

Great place to impress.   Filet mignon was cooked perfectly.  Portion sizes were good.  Service was excellent.  Very friendly wait staff.  Restaurant's website pictures of the decor don't do it justice.   The chocolate paradise dessert was very yummy.

Last night we celebrated our 11th wedding anniversary at Mark's and we cannot say enough about how great it was. I have never had the service that we received anywhere else in Gainesville. Our server, Pauly was fantastic and spot on with his recommendations. The food was delicious and was presented well. It was very nice that on a busy Friday night that we did not feel rushed to leave. Pauly, with the help of the kitchen staff timed everything perfectly. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here and we will be back. Thank you to all of the folks at Mark's Prime for a wonderful evening!!
Exemplary service from Joseph. The filet mignon and grouper Santa Fe were absolutely outstanding. Don't pass up the creme brulee. Would highly recommend.
Excellent steaks my second time coming here. I will definitely be back. Very  Prompt service
delicious, wonderful atmosphere, great experience!

Service was absolutely perfect Tony did a excellent job. I had the bone in ribeye and it was delicious with the hollandaise sauce.  We had the bacon wrapped scallops topped with mango salsa and were not nuts about the pairing but the scallops were great.
Excelent food.
Always a good meal at Mark's. A couple of glitches in the service, but they were quickly acknowledged and corrected. Mark's is one of my favorites.
5 star

This resturaunt is top notch.  I absolutely love it and there happy hr. Is the best, the servers are nice and very accommodating to anything you need. The steakes melt in your mouth such perfection go and treat yourself
Loved it will be going back soon.
Excellent food and impeccable service.
Superurb happy hour!

Great food, great atmosphere, and great service! We had the privilege of having Travis serve us. Treated us well! I had the bone in ribeye, it was cooked perfectly. Wife had grouper Sante feet, she enjoyed it. Dessert was awesome! Definitely recommend this restaurant!
Wonderful steaks and excellent service from Jonathan.  We really enjoyed our meal.
Service is always nice even when they have a full house. The service was friendly and sociable. This place has a good atmosphere.
It was wonderful. Had excellent bar service. Atmosphere friendly not too loud. My cocktail, French 75 perfectly made and served. And the calamari also perfect. Definitely a place to go and relax..
Very good traditional prime steakhouse. Ive been several times over a duration of 10 year's. Overall it's a fine establishment.
Food was great!
Excellent pork chop and Brussel sprouts
Lobster escargot
Best customer service I've experienced at a restaurant. The staff went above and beyond my expectations and that of my colleagues.
Great food. Excellent service. Best steak house around. Your stomach will thank you.
I've have steaks from San Francisco to Washington D.C. Mark's is in the top 10 of America.
Nice experience
Staff was very professional and kinda from the initial phone call all the way to leaving the restaurant. Food was tasty.

Great steaks and menu, not the best service for the standard of the food/prices.  Reservation for 4 people we got nice seats, the menu looks delicious with clear options of great steaks and sea food starts from $30-$40  The service was under the expectations since you barely can find a waiter around when you need them, felt like a simple service not a nice restaurant hospitality. Even though we got on the house a 15 min delayed steak + desert (thanks to their mistake and good management), that was nice and made us leave satisfied.
We were in town visiting and stopped in Mark's.  Steak was perfect and the staff was awesome. Classy, delicious, and fun!
First time there. Get the bigger filet. Just trust me, they serve it with metled butter. Try not to get filled up on the bread - tough.

Went for our son's graduation. We were extremely disappointed. Entrees were ala carte which we knew and was fine but no bread was even offered. Took an hour for the food to come after ordering. The steaks had no flavor, no seasoning, and a couple were down right leathery. The twice baked potatoes were only hollowed out about 1/4 and were served room temperature so the melted cheese had hardened. Go to Outback or Longhorn - you will save A LOT of money and have a way better meal.

Went for a personal gathering of about 9 people. Staff was extremely rude. Tuesday evening they werebr busy and it took 45 minutes for our food. WHEN the Food was sent out, it was wrong and waitress offered no concessions or to replace it. Hostess was rude as well.  3 out of 5 of our meals were wrong. No flavor, cold. Complete waste of Money.  I wished I could rate below a one star. They do not even deserve one. Would no recommend nor return.
Very nice steakhouse
I drop people around there but one famous actor goes there
Great food and staff. A bit pricy.
Delicious food and atmosphere
James our waiter was SECOND TO None
Excellent service. Had the delmonico and grouper. The food is top notch.

Wow! Where to begin... Mark's was recommended to us by our airbnb host as a special place to celebrate my husband's birthday. We are forever in his debt, because this was unquestionably the best meal either of us have ever had. The decor is beautiful, polished wood and antique in appearance. The ambiance was very pleasant and the staff couldn't be more attentive and helpful. We both chose the surf & turf with grilled asparagus & fingerling potatoes as sides. Delicious homemade warm bread with real butter started the meal. The filets & lobster tails were beyond wonderful. Perfectly seasoned & perfectly done. The sides were exceptional as well, again perfectly seasoned & cooked. Portions were so generous, we couldn't eat everything. Dessert was a chocolate... something. Heavenly! This isn't a cheap place to have dinner - but it's worth every penny!
The Filet Mignon is to die for... Highly recommended.
Was a top end restaurant price with bottom in food.  41$ for a 16oz steak with no flavor the people here was a 10 the food was a 3 not good

We have come to Marks in Gainesville for over 10 years. This weekend was by far the absolute worst. The steaks were all very tough. When we mentioned it to the waiter he got a manager and the manager offered us sharper knives. (Sorry a knife will NOT change the texture of your meat).  We ordered a meal without dairy due to allergy, and specifically added that means no butter and no cream and were brought 3 dishes to the individual with an allergy with dairy. My fish was served with a sharp piece of hard plastic that I chewed in the shape of a star (like decor or a piece of confetti) on it that I spit out thinking it was a large bone  and showed the manager.  So disappointed in a restaurant that used to be so nice. Hopefully it was just an anomaly. However being offered a sharper knife for tough steak I would guess we were not the first.....
Great steak, perfect for a client dinner.
There are no word that can explain how good the food was. From the appetizer to the desert, everything was top noch. Our waitress was great also she was very attentive to everything.
Excellent steaks, seafood and other entrees as well as extensive wine selection and cocktails. Old Steak House charm with a seasoned wait staff.
Really great experience! steak was cooked to perfection and really enjoyed the ambiance
Steak appetizer & happy hour, wow!

I love this place! The calamari app is delicious and great for sharing. Their homemade blue cheese dressing is amazing, and the petit filet is one of the few steaks i ever order or eat. We always get the sauteed spinach, mushrooms, and lobster mac & cheese for the table to share. My favorite celebratory dinner place, but also a great happy hour meetup with friends!
Outstanding food and service. Just the pork chop. Perfectly cooked.
Excellent food and service!!!
Everything was excellent except asparagus was burnt.
EXCELLENT  !!!@
The food is normally really good and my favorite appetizer is the lobster escargot. I think I prefer the Mark's in Ocala over the one in Gainesville though.

First off they kept changing waiters on us - not wait-teams but different waiters. I had asked several questions to one waitress about which items were gluten-free due to allergies then had to repeat them to the 3rd waiter. Food came out slow. Several other people who ordered after us got their food before ours. My steak was WAY over-cooked. An 11oz filet asked for “medium” came out dry and nearly burnt.  Then I told the waiter we were now running late for the play around the corner and that even took forever to get the check to us and then to come back with the receipt to pay.  The play had an intermission and I was concerned about picking up my car that was valet parked, so I called the restaurant. They told me the valet stand closes at 9:45 so I had to leave before the play was over. When I picked up my car I found that the information I was given was incorrect.  It was our first visit and probably our last.
Finest restaurant in Gainesville! Every single item was the best of the best.
We always enjoy it here. Great steaks and awesome service. Fantastic bourbon selection too!
Not on their game tonight. Excellent service is the best I can say about Mark's tonight.
Always food and service to perfection
Amazing, as always. The staff is on point & the manager is always super friendly and helpful. Food is great, too.
Excellent quality food, steak and sides were cooked to perfection and served in a upscale manner
Great food,  atmosphere, and service.  We will be back regularly!
Omg best rebeye ever
Great service and fantastic food

Went here tonight after good Gator win.   We Spent $400 before tip and were extremely disappointed.  Had to send my New York Strip back because it was cold. The steak was not the quality you would expect to receive at a steakhouse.    I could have gone to Outback and had a better dinner for a lot less.  Don’t waste your time or money.  Managment did not seem to care.   Will never go back there and would recommend one of the other restaurants in the area.
Avoid is place! Terrible steakhouse period. We had to send 2 meals back very cold and as a result family style sides we cold for those in our party:(.

Worst steakhouse ever. If you go here get the lobster pasta it may come out warm. The steaks will definitely come out cold.  Don’t bother to complain...the Mangement doesn’t care. This place is most likely on its last leg...don’t throw your good money after a bad meal. Wait in line at dragonfly next door or get some bbq at mojo within a 1 minute walk.

Oh my god. Oh my god. This place calls them self a restaurant. Oh my god. No. Never come here. This I an absolute waste of money.  You can cook steak probably better yourself. And the serving staff has less of an in then my left shoe. Never go here and make sure this place goes out of buissness
Awesome food
Great food, waitress was very friendly and attentive.
Happy Hour is the best. Try it out and you won't regret going. Servers can be a tad bit slow grabbing your checks.

Expensive,  average steaks, average service.  Nice atmosphere.  Be sure to have a reservation on the weekend.  1 out of 3 visits was disappointing.  Mostly because of the server's attitude,  slow service.  Other times were good.
Great experience!

This place is great, however, it is NOT a two $$ establishment. Do not come here expecting a $$ meal. The food is beyond delicious and the service and atmosphere is top notch. It will definitely cost you $$$$ but it is worth it.
Sabrina is the BEST ever!!!!! Thank you for everything
Best steaks and service in town!
(Translated by Google) Stakes ☆☆☆  (Original) 스태이크 ☆☆☆

I went to Mark's for Valentine's Day.  They were featuring a limited menu of about 4 choices per App, Salad, Entree, and then 3 desserts.  I knew this going into the meal, but it was still disappointing because they had none of their most interesting full menu items.  The overall feel of the meal was that we were animals being mass processed as fast as possible. We were seated in a room that was clearly made for 20+ person events, and they just put ~20 two person tables right next to each other. The lighting was far too bright, there were no decorations on any walls of any kind, and there was no division between tables. We could see and hear everyone else in the room. Also, there were about 10 waiters running around crazily at any given time which was very distracting. For the price, the food was TERRIBLE. The price was $145 per couple and two items we ordered were inedible. I know it was Valentine's day so they wanted to get people in and out, but for the price you really should get a better ambiance than the conveyor belt.  For appetizer, we chose the Oysters Rockefeller. They were poor and not what one would expect to get from such a dish. They only managed to put bacon on half of them, and they were waaay too heavy handed with the olive oil. They were very one note. Still, this was only the 3rd worst item we ordered.  The salads were fine. I mean, they were salads.  For main course we each got Filet & Lobster tail. The filets were good, for filets. It's not our favorite cut of steak but this was by far the most interesting main dish on the limited menu, especially based on the price tag of the meal.  My girlfriend's lobster was good but mine was a little overcooked and chewy.  For side dishes, we both attempted to order mashed potatoes. The waiter convinced us that the sides were "huge" and that we could easily share the potatoes and get a second side dish. From the start, I wasn't thrilled about this because the other side options were cauliflower, spinach, and asparagus, but I took his recommendation and went with the cauliflower because it was au gratin. In reality, the mashed potatoes were definitely not big enough to share. It was a single serving. Also, I'm pretty sure the cooks never even looked at salt while making them. Very bland. The cauliflower WAS big enough for two people, but it was undercooked and inedible. It tasted like it was raw; it was far too crunchy. I took only one bite.  For dessert, we tried the "strawberry cheesecake". It was actually plain cheesecake with strawberry sauce on top. This dish was also inedible. The sauce was cloying and completely overpowered everything. It tasted like it came from a can. A gross can. We took only one bite.  Post Review Bonus Update: After my review, a manager contacted me and apologized for the poor experience I had, which I appreciated. He asked if I would give Mark's another shot if he sent me a gift card in the mail. I said I would, and gave him my address. He never responded or sent the gift card. After my experience in the restaurant, I am not surprised with the lack of follow through.  I did not EXPECT a freebie after leaving my initial review, but the fact that one was offered and not delivered is pretty weak.
Food was just ok
Steak prepared well. But keep in mind, this restaurant is very, very expensive.
Great. Experience at Mark's...Great service... The food was excellent.
Great food, excellent service
Amber was perfect and the food was amazing.... highly recommended
Great food & service
The meat dishes are your best options so don't go here if you are not a hardcore meat lover. The service is always good and it is clear the owners and management are willing to invest in service.

Wanted a special night for my Birthday and decided upon Mark's due to the ratings and reviews.  Well we were not disappointed.  I did not even have to say it was my Birthday to get special treatment, we got that just for walking through the door!  Our Waiter Fred went above and beyond and made us feel that this is the way we should be treated no matter what type of restaurant we walk into!  The atmosphere was very close knit and personal!  Even down to cleaning up the crumbs dropped on the table cloth from the delicious bread!  The food was way beyond expectations.  My husband ordered the 11oz Filet Mignon  (which he couldn't even finish) with a side of mashed potatoes and I had the Asiago Spinach stuffed chicken with Cauliflower au gratin.  Of course we had a doggie bag from all the food!  It was a little pricey, but well worth it.  This will definitely be our go to place for our special occasions and recommend everyone needing to feel like royalty go there!
Good food
Delmonico was tender even though a little lackluster in respect to flavor. The sides were bland and just so so.

Atmosphere was nice, would not say romantic which I was hoping for. Music was not our favorite type of genre and could have done without.    Food was good,  we had the filet surf and turf steak was cooked to perfection, lobster was a tad overdone.   Also had the green beans, I liked them husband was not a fan.  And delmonico potatoes ok but nothing fancy.    Than we topped it off with cream brulee which was good but have had better.  The waiter was good,  very attentive. All in all for the $$$$ they charge was not that impressed.
Perfectly cooked prime beef served by attentive staff in a nice atmosphere.

Took my fiance here to dinner after proposing, and it was exceptional! She said it was the best steak she'd ever had. We both had the 16 oz Delmonico's, and they were cooked to perfection! Perfect med rare. Sides were outstanding as well. We had grilled asparagus, sauted mushrooms, mashed potatoes, and bacon roasted brussel sprouts .the homemade bread was great as well. Jessica, our server was exceptional! Very personable, and friendly, with outstanding knowledge of the menu. Five star experience no doubt! Pricey, but so worth it! We will definitely return for special occasions! Oh, and my fiance said yes!!

I started with the lobster escargot. This was a whole lobster tail cut into six pieces and put into an escargot dish. It was soaked in butter and just a little garlic and topped with Asiago cheese melted on top. Although the lobster chunks were huge, it was not that flavorful, and should have had more garlic. I still enjoyed it and would order it again. My entree was grouper Santa Fe. This was a large piece of fish topped with a mango salsa.  This was exceptional. The sides of grilled asparagus and twice baked potato was excellent. Service was spot on and it was very quiet. We really enjoyed our dining experience and would go back again...... and again.
Excellent food, good service.
Attended as a guest in party of ten.  Had salmon and chopped salad.  Salmon was very good.  Chopped salad at Subway is better.  Steaks were incredibly expensive, maybe I need to be less picky.
I went to Mark's Prime for my sister's undergraduate graduation! It's very prestigious! The service was impeccable! The food came still sizzling hot!
Fabulous dinner celebrating  our friend's birthday! Drinks, food and service excellent! See you next time ♡
Good place to eat Best steak in town highly recommend
One of the best in town
Over cooked steak and chared and dried fish special, sad presentation
Everything about this place is great.
quality premium steaks with delicious taste. Professional service and a comfortable relaxing environment.
The best steak I've had in years and very pleasant and professional wait staff. Highly recommend.
Delicious. Steaks are great and sides are also really delicious

We had been to this restaurant before and were very pleased. However, this time we had a bit of an issue. We had a reservation for 7:30 and arrived at 7:20. We were quickly seated and then greeted by several young gentemen who quickly set us up,  gave us menus, poured water, and gave us a wine list. My husband quickly picked a wine and told one of the guys setting us up what bottle of wine we would like.  Glasses were brought and then our main waitress showed up. Her attitude was less than pleasant. She asked us about ordering wine and my husband said he had given his request to "the guy who was just here". Her response, "well since he cant take an order you need to give it to me". Now, it would not have been a big deal but she could have 1) tried to figure it out from who set us up or 2) been a bit more friendly and polite instead of arrogant and demeaning in her tone and attitude.  We also at this time gave her our order. Then things went from bad to worse. After an hour of waiting for food and a second bottle of wine later ( there were 5 drinking wine) we still did not have food. When I asked the waitress about our order she quickly replied it was our fault for not ordering appetizers or salad. Say what????? Then she said let me check and came back and said there was a delay in the kitchen. What the????  In my mind, if there were a delay in the kitchen she could have told us about it instead of me having to ask, could have been nicer in her response ( really... you have to wait for your food if you only order dinner? ) and  maybe should have offered something to tide us over until the order would arrive? Finally, our dinner arrives and everyone had their steaks as ordered except for me. It is now 8:45 and I am sitting there with a well done instead of medium rare steak. I tried to eat it since I was hungry but could not choke it down.  She came by to ask how my steak was and I said over cooked. She asked me if I wanted to have a new one prepared but honestly, after waiting over an hour the first time, no... I am not waiting again. Also, everyone knows what happens in the kitchen after you complain :}  Everyone will be finished before I even get my steak!!  So.. the next thing you know a manager shows up with a brand new filet. Overall, I will say the food was GREAT!! However, I expect when I am spending $500 on dinner, the staff better be polite, well trained,  and personable.
Excellent Steakhouse

We had the crab cakes & the twice baked potato. The crab cakes were fairly small but the sauce that was on the plate was so savory. The twice baked potato was large and flavorful ( only issue was that the cheese was like a top layer that really didn’t melt so I pulled it off ) otherwise I would strongly recommend this place..
Great food!
Excellent food and service was outstanding.
Mark's May be the best steak house in Gainesville. The steak was perfect. The bread was baked fresh and crusty.And the potato was huge. It was quiet and intimate and the staff was great.
Best kept secret for happy hour in Gainesville. Also, fantastic drinks and steaks but definitely the happy hour spot.
Service and food excellent!
Great food, huge portions! The sides are ginormous and can definitely be shared. Pricey but worth it.

Spectacular service and the food was damn near perfect 🙂 Crab cake appetizer was my favorite part of the meal. I think this place easily beats Embers. Would recommend! Brandon who looked like a manager check on us and was very friendly.

The steak here is amazing. I got the petite filet medium rare, but my friend got her's rare and the but she shared melted in my mouth. They have a good selection of wine and can give recommendations based on what flavors you like. The lobster Mac and cheese and the Lyonaise potatoes were good. We weren't fans of the creamed spinach. There is also complimentary valet parking which is nice on Friday and Saturday night.
Elegant environment, beautiful food, and fantastic service! Great date night

This place is phenomenal, I'm honestly shocked it's not just a 5 star place. I was very shocked with how well the food and service was. My last stop with Ruth's Chris and was so disappointed. This place is where I would be weekly if I lived in the area.

We weren’t able to get a table at dragonfly next door so we stopped in to Marks. Even though they were full, we were given the option of a table in the bar so we took it. It was a pleasant table by the window and the bar was busy but quiet. It took several minutes before we were greeted by a server and that was the way the service went the whole evening. It felt as though because we weren’t in her general section we didn’t receive the full benefit of a server. We waited between courses for more than we should’ve, waited in drink refills and had to ask for refills on coffee. We waited for a really long time after completing our dinner before anyone came to take our plates and byv hen it was too late to ask for dessert as we were leaving town after a long day visiting UF.   The food was very good but the service always affects the experience. Not at all what I’d expected from a fine dining steakhouse.  It was our first visit here and I don’t really expect to return. A really disappointing end to a rather wonderful day.
This is my Celebration and special occasion place to go. Very upscale dinning experience. Large portions, perfectly cooked steaks.

I've always liked Mark's. Excellent service, very good food, and a great experience. Stable for decades, I enjoy Mark's for small intimate dinners as well as group events.  By far, one of the best dining experiences you'll have in Gainesville and well worth the price.
One of the best steaks you can have. As good as any famous US steak restaurant and better than most!
Excellent food and service every time. Love the bar too!
It was good but I have had better for less money!
love it

I made reservations for Mark's Prime with great excitement, as it's one of a very few high-end eateries in Gainesville. I was looking forward to a night of fantastic food, but was sorely disappointed. The ambiance was great, but the food was mediocre. Fine dining prices for not-so-fine food.
The food was awesome and our waiter Jordan is a top notch server. Intimate atmosphere
Amazing steaks and service.
Nice ambience. Excellent service. A bit costly for the location. Seafood grill was bland for my taste.
The Best Steak in town!
Excellent steak. Sides were also delicious.

The service was great. They were welcoming however we ordered our steak "oscar" and they forgot it, brought it back out served it again,  forgot the hollandaise sauce and said they needed to ask to see if that was actually part of it. Then brought the sauce out later.  We had to correct them twice. We were still charged extra for this.  Very disappointed.  The steak was just ok, the dessert was just ok, but the seafood platter,  bacon wrapped scallops and french onion soup were AMAZING. Just alittle disappointed. We thought for the price they would be a little more classy.
A high quality steak house. Price is high so plan on spending a pretty penny.
Great place for enjoying meat and more !
excellent service, great food very pricing
Usually pretty good, but the last three times I've gone, my steak has been suuuuper salty. Hopefully that will change soon.
Overpriced, decent steak but I've had better for less. Drink prices are outrageous
Overpriced for what you get.  Average quality food and service.  Definitely not a restaurant that we will return to.
(Translated by Google) Loved it! Great food and service!  (Original) Amei! Excelente comida e serviço!
Superb service, outstanding food,great drinks,wonderful ambience. The  top .

I recently met up with some friends here for happy hour. It was a great experience. The steak tips and salmon appetizers were super. The service was fast and friendly, and each cocktail was perfect. I will definitely be back!

Love this place for every occasion! Whether it's a romantic dinner, birthday celebration or just out for a good meal,  Marks in downtown Gainesville is the place to go. I just attended the nightly Happy Hour and everything was wonderful. Crafts cocktails, filet tips and excellent service in a fun & lively atmosphere. Will be back again soon!
The steaks are phenomenal, it's a very upscale and expensive restaurant but very good quality.
Best buttery steak in town 👍
Great food, but honestly, not worth the bang for the buck. Maybe what I had wasn't one of their bests, but I wouldn't pick here for the price if I was choosing.
Excellent service, staff & fine dining experience.  Highly recommended.

I had another PERFECT evening at Mark's.  I made a reservation online for two people that same night to celebrate with my husband.  He was able to change the reservation online to 30 minutes later without a problem.  I then decided to turn our date night dinner to a surprise dinner.  I called before they opened to change the reservation from 2 to 6 people.  The hostess was very nice and said it was no problem at all.  I then called an hour later to change it to 8 people.  Also no problem.  The hostess even asked how to recognize the person being surprised!  When my husband and I arrived on time to the dinner, the rest of the party had not arrived yet.  The hostess put us at a small table on one side and snuck everyone else down the other side.  When everyone arrived, the hostess told us someone wanted to say hi and that is when my husband realized it was a surprise dinner.  The food was AMAZING.  We had scallop appetizer, steaks, and a side of mashed potatoes.  I love this place.  The staff are always attentive and courteous.  I love the valet service right up front.  Thank you so much for everything your restaurant did for us last night.
It's very elegant, staff is wonderful, food is great
Expensive says it all, but a great place to take a client to impress or that special someone.
Amazing service and food
Great service and good steaks.
Best filet mignon east of the Mississippi
We keep coming back here. One of the better places to eat in Gainesville. Steaks are good, and so are the sides.

The food at Marks prime is excellent. The service is always spot on. The bone in ribeye is to die for. Be sure to order the grilled asparagus. I have read some of the negative reviews on Marks and do not believe them, go to Marks and enjoy yourself. The valet parking is a big plus for downtown dining.

This place is way overpriced. I went here for a special occasion expecting the best steak I have ever tasted due in large part to this place's reputation around town. I found it to be over priced for a decent piece of meat. The service was good and the ambiance was great but I don't ever plan on coming back. If I am going for a fine dining experience in Gainesville, I will be going to Manuel's Vintage Room.
Good place for a special occasion.

Very good steakhouse with a large selection. For the price, I have been to much much better. But for Gainesville, this was excellent dining. Complimentary valet takes you right from the entrance of the restaurant and the service is excellent.
I agree with the comment save money and go to Embers!! The steaks are tough, potatoes are dry, Bad food and Horrible Service.  Will not go back!!

Definitely not worth the money. The cooking is bland and uninspired. Brussel sprouts raw, lobster tail "escargot" appetizer greasy and tasteless, bread cheap, steaks tough and overcooked, cheesecake truly not good. Save your money and go to Embers instead.
Great place, although expensive the food is awesome. Went for valentines day.
Great food, but plenty of room on the plate for more. This is a tasteful representation of how food should taste and the service presentable. The staff are experienced and helpful.
My boyfriend and I had a great experience at Mark's. The waiter was fast and friendly. The food came out quick and everything was cooked to perfection. We will be returning.

For a steakhouse, I was unimpressed. The steak had so much pepper on it I could not eat it. If it's quality steak you do not need that much pepper. I got calamari for an appetizer and it was drenched in grease. You have to drain the grease before throwing it on a plate! The server was not professional as you would expect from a steakhouse. She was more like a server from cracker barrel or some informal sports bar. At the end of the meal she ran our card twice! On a 90 dollar bill! Are you serious?! The food was not even worth $90. Will not be back.
Outstanding food and service!  Try the Chocolate Paradise for desert, it was amazing.

The food is fabulous! Best filet I've ever had, served on a plate that felt as though it was 500F. It definitely kept my food hot throughout the whole meal. Dessert was to die for. I had the Chocolate Paradise. I highly recommend it. Our server, Roy, was very attentive and gave us the best service. Dress up nice and be prepared to pay for excellent food.
I've never had steak this good. The sides were amazing as well. Nice atmosphere and good service.
Well, let's start off with I was probably under dressed. The filet was fabtabulous. Perfectly cooked . I will also tell you to bring big bills , because it's not cheap. Great service!
Food was good!  Service absolutely sucked!!!  Will try it again, hopefully it was just an off night.
FYI - went to reservation site and it said the date I wanted was totally "booked". Gave them a call directly and was able to get my reservation.
Great service and great food..

Prices way too high for quantity and steak was tough.   Only 4 large shrimp in cocktail.  Once my 2nd steak returned, all plates and silverware were already picked up so I had to get it in a to go box.  Very sad experience for my first time there.

disappointing, me and group used their Florida room for a party. The service was great, but the food was ok. $12 for two crab cakes with about an inch diameter each, oyster rockefeller was good but the oysters had a slight smell to them no issues after eating though. I got the petite tenderloin Oscar style, the steak itself was extremely tender but was lacked much of any type of seasoning, it came with 3 pieces of asparagus, and the hollandaise sauce lacked much flavor as well. Overall I feel this restaurant could be great and may have been at one time but the food just tasted lazy and extremely under par for the price. I would highly recommend Embers off 34th if your looking for a great steakhouse in gainesville.

Tried to call the telephone number for a reservation on Valentines for two weeks. Left multiple messages (at least 4!) No response WHAT SO EVER. We used to come here often, but we will be taking our business elsewhere. What kind business has a number posted for reservations, and a voice mail system, but won't return messages? Understandable if one message got lost in transaction, but more than that? Bad customer service. I understand you can book online, but not everyone has access. We had set aside a good amount of money to spend with you tomorrow night, but obviously we will be spending our money elsewhere from now on.
By far the best steaks in gainesville.

On an involuntary family visit to Gainesville for Shands hospital I wanted to take my dad somewhere nice for a Friday night.  He wanted a good steak and this place was recommend to us.  My dad had the Del Monaco and I had the Mixed Seafood Grill.  Both were excellent.  The seafood dish came with a buttery apple pineapple sauce on the side that was amazing for dipping!  When you go out for a nice meal and you're still thinking about it 6 hours later you know it was good.  I am not a food person but this place was damn good!  Next time we are driving through on i75 we will be pulling off for a snack!  Thanks guys.
